Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
INSIGHT
A {simulation} and modelling language especially for health care problems.
["Simulation Modeling with INSIGHT", S.D. Roberts Proc 1983 Winter Sim Conf, S.D. Roberts et al eds, pp.7-16].
(1995-03-03)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Insight \In"sight`\, n. 1. A sight or view of the interior of anything; a deep inspection or view; introspection; -- frequently used with into. [1913 Webster]
He had an insight into almost all the secrets of state. --Jortin. [1913 Webster]
2. Power of acute observation and deduction; penetration; discernment; perception. [1913 Webster]
Quickest insight In all things that to greatest actions lead. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
in sight adj : at or within a reasonable distance for seeing; "not a policeman in sight"; "kept the monkey in view" [syn: {in view}]

insight n 1: clear or deep perception of a situation [syn: {penetration}] 2: a feeling of understanding [syn: {perceptiveness}, {perceptivity}] 3: the clear (and often sudden) understanding of a complex situation [syn: {brainstorm}, {brainwave}] 4: grasping the inner nature of things intuitively [syn: {sixth sense}]
